-- | Reading and writing VCD files.
--   
--   Defined by the Verilog standard, VCD (value change dump) is a file
--   format for capturing digital and analog waveforms, typically from HDL
--   simulation.

-- | Types that can be recorded as VCD variables.
class Variable a

-- | Helper to create new <a>Variable</a> instances.

-- | Create a new handle for generating a VCD file with a given timescale.

-- | Set a time step. <a>step</a> will also transition a VCDHandle from the
--   definition to the recording phase.
step :: VCDHandle -> Int -> IO ()

-- | Save as <a>step</a>, but forces a step recording even if variables
--   have not changed. Useful for realtime simulation.
